Description: Egyptian terracotta figure of male cult member in ‘grotesque’ style. Head only. Bald, consistent with representations of priests or followers of Ptah or Harpocrates. Mould-made and hollow. Probably originally wearing a festival wreath headdress, added after this was removed from the mould, since lost. Red-brown Nile silt fabric with grey core.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.499) (Phase 3)
